title: rpcdaemon `eth_blockNumber` is stuck at `0xcceeb5` when `eth_getBlockByNumber` is in sync
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `thorax/erigon:v2021.10.03`

OS & Version: Linux under docker/k8s

#### Expected behaviour

rpcdaemon should answer with the latest block as informed by the erigon's log

#### Actual behaviour

A call to `eth_blockNumber` is stuck at `0xcceeb5` and calling for `eth_getBlockByNumber` on recent blocks just returns a proper answer.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

```
curl -s http://localhost:8545 \
    -X POST \
    -d '{"method":"eth_blockNumber","params":[],"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0"}' \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" | jq "{ number: .result }"
{
  "number": "0xcceeb5"
}
# query for block 13493461, see erigon log below
curl -s http://localhost:8545 \
    -X POST \
    -d '{"method":"eth_getBlockByNumber","params":["0xcde4d5", false],"id":100,"jsonrpc":"2.0"}' \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" | jq "{ number: .result.number, hash: .result.hash }"
{
  "number": "0xcde4d5",
  "hash": "0xc9fec158a2ec57966c03383add3cd1e50dadb002720057908d4192d95367b1af"
}
```

**rpcdaemon logs**

```
[INFO] [10-26|13:34:48.925] DB schemas compatible                    reader=3.0.0 database=3.0.0
[INFO] [10-26|13:34:48.926] rpc filters: subscribing to Erigon events 
[INFO] [10-26|13:34:48.927] HTTP endpoint opened                     url=0.0.0.0:8545 ws=false ws.compression=false
[INFO] [10-26|13:35:02.566] interfaces compatible                    remote_db= client=4.0.0 server=4.0.0
[INFO] [10-26|13:35:02.567] interfaces compatible                    remote_service=eth_backend client=2.1.0 server=2.1.0
[INFO] [10-26|13:35:02.567] interfaces compatible                    remote_service=mining client=1.0.0 server=1.0.0
[INFO] [10-26|13:35:02.568] interfaces compatible                    remote_service=tx_pool client=1.0.0 server=1.0.0
```

Is there any way I can increase the verbosity of logs on `rpcdaemon` to try to track this ?

run plz:
```
./build/bin/integration print_stages --datadir=<your_datadir>
```
(because eth_blockNumber actually returns stage.Finish progress)

runnig `eth_getBlockByNumber` with `"latest"` gives the same

```
curl -s http://localhost:8545 \
    -X POST \
    -d '{"method":"eth_getBlockByNumber","params":["latest", false],"id":666,"jsonrpc":"2.0"}' \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" | jq "{ number: .result.number, hash: .result.hash }"
{
  "number": "0xcceeb5",
  "hash": "0x046bc5871d35380fb6a8da79d469f780b5e0eb9a3cb826d777d3e4888cf5db58"
}
```

> print_stages --datadir=<your_datadir>

```
/usr/local/bin $ integration print_stages --datadir=/var/lib/erigon

Your node is not in sync yet after long downtime (it need sync 60K blocks - see difference between stage.Body and stage.Execution). Erigon move all stages at once only if gump < 8K blocks. Otherwise you need wait for get mode in sync.

Or you have some Error in logs.

This error repeats forever, and it's just +1 after (13430454) the last block on execution stage (13430453).

```
[EROR] [10-27|13:23:52.434] [7/18 Execution] Empty block             blocknum=13430454
```

The real block is not empty
https://etherscan.io/block/13430454

Try (order of commands is important):
```
./build/bin/integration state_stages --datadir=<your_datadir> --unwind=500 --integrity.fast=false
./build/bin/integration stage_bodies --datadir=<your_datadir> --unwind=500 
./build/bin/integration stage_headers --datadir=<your_datadir> --unwind=500 
```
